results.title: A One two many world
results.creator_credit: Peter Harcourt, Richard Swinden and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of cinematic metaphor, made by students of Queen’s University. The world of this film, one in which a growing boy finds himself, is a world of imposed conditions and contradictions. Here children turn adult by putting on the appropriate uniforms - the policeman’s, the soldier’s. Many of the sequences are surrealistic in effect, creating a social commentary expressed in symbolic language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Harcourt, Richard Swinden and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A One and a two = Yi yi
results.creator_credit: Edward Yang, Naokto Tsukeda, Shinya Kawai, Atom Films, Omega Project and Pony Canyon
results.brief_description: A ruminative work of great beauty, contemplation and poignancy, “Yi-yi” is a film about three generations of a Taiwanese family, grappling with the notions of regret and acceptance of life’s turbulence. Director Edward Yang (highly regarded for his sprawling masterpiece “Brighter, sunny day”) shows great understanding of the human condition giving his protagonists space for introspection as they reflect over their fate. Winner of Best Director at Cannes 2000, this is an intelligent, detailed piece, which accumulates to create a complex tapestry — about alienation in modern life, dysfunctional families and the desire for happiness. Cast includes: Wu Nien-Jen, Kelly Lee, Elaine Jin, Chen Xisheng, and Jonathan Chang.

results.title: A Place in the sun
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Musser, Junior League of San Francisco and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: This film reveals the work being accomplished by doctors and specialists working in schools especially for the treatment of cerebral palsy. Children are seen being helpted to improve their muscular co-ordination and learning to do things for themselves such as putting on shoes, doing up buttons, and handling a knife and fork. Shows through patient handling by their instructors, the children are enabled to return to their own homes where the treatment is carried on by their parents under supervision.

results.title: A Place in the country: Renfrewshire Regional Park
results.creator_credit: David Lewis, Films of Scotland and Tree Films
results.brief_description: Describes the first country park to be established in Scotland. Different groups of people are seen visiting the park: a family picnic party, a young couple going for a walk, two hikers and a party of school children. A regatta at Castle Semple Loch is shown. The film shows the range of attractions the park holds for all.

results.title: A Pinto for the Prince
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, John Spotton, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In 1977, Prince Charles was inducted as honorary chief of the Blood Indians on their reserve in southwestern Alberta. The ceremony, conducted in the great Circle of the Sun Dance, commemorated the centennial anniversary of the original signing of Treaty 7 by Queen Victoria.

results.title: A Night on the town
results.creator_credit: Judith de Paul, John Vernon, BBC and Brent Walker Film Productions
results.brief_description: A theatre production of music, song and dance filmed without an audience, “A Night on the town” is a foray into the world of nightclubs in Berlin, London, New York, New Orleans and Paris through a nostalgic recreation of the thirties. It features the music of Irving Berling, Noel Coward, Cole Porter and George Gershwin (An American in Paris) performed by the BBC Concert Orchestra, conducted by Alexander Faris. The cast includes Hinton Battle, Lewis Collins, Frank Gorshin, Eartha Kitt, John Moffatt, Elaine Paige, Ann Reinking, Bobby Short along with the Ambrosian Chorus. Staged and choreographed by Terry Gilbert with guest choreography Irving Davies (An American in Paris).

results.title: A New world below
results.creator_credit: Mike Mahoney, Barry Cowling, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The extension of Canada’s coastal sovereignty to 322 km (200 miles), together with the increase in offshore oil and gas activity, has led to a dramatic increase in the demand for knowledge about the sea. The film highlights the work of the Atlantic Geoscience Centre, Bedford Institute of Oceanography, in Nova Scotia. Stunning visuals include rolling icebergs and undersea volcanoes. Research is shown to depend on both high-technology and patient, minute analysis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Mahoney, Barry Cowling, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Nomad boy
results.creator_credit: Denis Hargrave, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Portrays Somalia, an African country near the Red Sea, with emphasis on its nomadic camel herders. Features Ismael, a 12-year-old boy, who spends his life searching for pastures for his flocks. Suitable for upper primary and lower seconday levels.

results.title: A Musician in the family
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The young son of a prairie farmer, against considerable opposition, achieves his ambition—a musical education. Andrew’s father fears that a musician in the family may affect the future of the farm, and tries to discourage the boy’s attachment to his trombone. On Andrew’s side are his mother, his teacher and a neighbour, while the farm animals patiently serve as his rehearsal audience. Perseverance wins him a place among the contestants in the annual provincial music festival, and the encouraging words of the adjudicator help sway his father to acceptance of the boy’s music.

results.title: A Mongolian tale
results.creator_credit: Xie Fei, Ma Fung Kwok, Wellington Fung and China Film Co
results.brief_description: This film attractively depicts the harsh life of the Mongolian Steppes, it is a deeply moving film. An old woman lives a lonely traditional life on the beautiful Mongolian Steppes. She and her orphaned granddaughter eke out a living as shepherds. When a fathers asks to leave his little boy with them to be brought up, the old lady acepts gracefully. The children grow up a brither and sister, learning to survive the blistering summers and freezing winters. They cant afford a horse, but as fate would have it, a lost foal wanders into their compound one cold night and becomes the boys proudest possession. The children grow up and become engaged, the young man leaves for the city and an education. Upon his return, his sweetheart has become pregnant to the local bully In Chinese with English subtitles.
